To calculate the probability of this product being high-quality, we need to consider the probability of the first two products being high-quality and this product being low-quality, and the probability of the first two products being low-quality and this product being high-quality. The probability of this product being high-quality, given the previous two were high-quality, is actually 2/3 because the probability of the first two products being high-quality is 25%, and the probability of this product being high-quality is 50%.
